entry.title: First Post - How I made the blog
entry.content:
The blog is served using github pages. It's been created using jekyll. There are other choices that seem good like pelican. Using jekyll, I also added poole to help with the setup and lanyon, an unassuming jekyll theme.

To install jekyll using Fedora 21, I used the following commands. Note that this approach will seem a little wonky because I was trying to also work around a jruby issue with fedora. I'm not saying this is the best way, it's just what worked for me.

$ sudo yum install jruby
$ sudo yum remove gem
$ sudo yum install gem
$ sudo yum install ruby-devel
$ gem install jekyll

Once the install has successfully completed, it's time to create a new project. I did this by simply cloning the lanyon github repo. I added the lanyon repository as upstream using git; my github pages repo was added as the origin.

After this initial setup, I just made smaller changes to fit my personal preferences.

Thanks Ty!
